1.caption_en: This figure illustrates how larger business ecosystems contain distinct sub-ecosystems (e.g., health, commerce, digital experience, input marketplaces) that connect through shared functions like mobility, talent, and services. These interconnected sub-ecosystems enable specialized networks, targeted resource allocation, and cross-pollination of ideas to drive innovation and sustainable growth.
1.caption_ru: This figure illustrates how larger business ecosystems contain distinct sub-ecosystems (e.g., health, commerce, digital experience, input marketplaces) that connect through shared functions like mobility, talent, and services. These interconnected sub-ecosystems enable specialized networks, targeted resource allocation, and cross-pollination of ideas to drive innovation and sustainable growth.

2.caption_en:
Ecosystems can be decomposed into sub-ecosystems that address distinct holistic needs, connect with adjacent domains, and enable targeted strategy, resource allocation, and cross-pollination of capabilities — illustrated by a central user, surrounding service bubbles, and an input marketplace diagram.

3.caption_en:
Slide explaining that business ecosystems contain distinct holistic needs which form interconnected sub-ecosystems; includes explanatory text and a central bubble diagram illustrating example sub-ecosystems and their links. The slide summarizes benefits of grouping sub-ecosystems for targeted strategy, cross-pollination, and sustainable growth.

{
  "type": "slide",
  "title": "Ecosystems group distinct holistic needs, and several relevant sub-ecosystems can be found within their domain, connecting them with other adjacent ecosystems",
  "language": "English",
  "layout": "three-column text with central diagram",
  "contains_diagram": true,
  "diagram_description": "Grayscale bubble/venn-style diagram showing a central user icon surrounded by labeled bubbles (e.g., Well-being, Care, Health, Wealth & Stability, Commerce, Input Marketplace, SME Services, Mobility, Travel, Digital Experience, Talent, Home, Enterprise Services) and arrows indicating connections between sub-ecosystems.",
  "body_text_summary": "Explains that larger business ecosystems consist of distinct holistic needs that can be grouped into sub-ecosystems (by industry vertical, customer segment, region, or value chain). Grouping enables deeper understanding of challenges and opportunities, targeted strategy/resource allocation, cross-pollination of ideas, and drives innovation, resilience, and sustainable growth.",
  "key_points": [
    "Sub-ecosystems connect entities with similar objectives, challenges, or focus areas.",
    "Grouping distinct holistic needs enables targeted strategy and ecosystem development.",
    "Connections between sub-ecosystems enable cross-pollination, mutual growth, and innovation."
  ],
  "visual_elements": [
    "Top headline in large bold type",
    "Left column: multiple explanatory paragraphs",
    "Center: detailed bubble diagram with arrows",
    "Right column: summary paragraph with bold concluding sentence",
    "Footer: source citation"
  ],
  "citation": "Source: Book \"The Ecosystem Economy\", 2022",
  "text_density": "high",
  "dominant_colors": [
    "white",
    "dark blue/teal",
    "gray"
  ],
  "image_resolution_estimate": "1365x768",
  "notes": "Right-column closing paragraph contains a bolded call to action about engaging with sub-ecosystems."
}
